RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 13250. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUJU NINETEEN raced from off the pace while he was allowed to settle in hands, improved position and was in contention at the five sixteenth pole, angled out six wide moving out of the turn and into the stretch, was driven down the land under strong urging and on the outside, caught the early leaders after passing the final sixteenth marker and sparked up a three way battle to the finish, with strong urging and having the momentum JUJU NINETEEN was able to inch past his other two rival at the wire and claimed the victory. ONE MORE BABY raced in hands along the fence for the first half mile, was asked and responded well after the half, angled out two wide and challenged near the three eighths, stayed in that same position down the lane under urging, was caught by an outside closer after the sixteenth, within a few strides they were next to the early leader and ensued in a three way horse race till the wire, ONEMORE BABY was beat by a nose but beat his other rival by a nose, comng away with second. PAYNTED LOVER vied and took the lead, raced along the rail through out, was caught after the sixteenth pole by two outside closers, raced in a three way struggle to the wire, ended up a third place finisher, but ran a winning race. BOSSHOG THEM DUKES was off the pace and four wide early on, launched a bid at the seven sixteenth pole, shifted two wide entering the lane, raced under urging but made no impact. SOUTH AL SPARKY was four wide early, stalked from the second tier, shifted in a bit to save ground, had no kick late. SHADY GRADY showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: One More Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hands, mid pack, rail, bid 1/2, 2w, 3waybattle, up for second

ENTRY.NAME: Bosshog Them Dukes
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4w, moved 7-16th, shifted2w, made no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Juju Nineteen
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, settled, rail, angled out 5-16th, 6w, 3waybattle,up

ENTRY.NAME: Paynted Lover
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, pace, rail, battled last 16th, came away with 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 7 1/2F Turf CR: 91. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 33000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE DECEMBER 11, 2022 OR CLAIMING PRICE $35,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 11, 2023 Allowe d 2 lbs. Claiming Price $35,000. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SILVER GALAXY was well off the pace early on, settled in hands for the first half of a mile, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, easily circled half of the field through the turn, built momentum up to close down the lane under strong urging, drew next to the early leaders at the sixteenth pole, engaged a three way charge for the last sixteenth of a mile, cleared the others by a nose and got the win. PLAY MO settled into the second tier on the outside, stalked the early leaders until the three eighths pole, was cued, responded nicely gaining ground and gaining momentum, shifted out five wide and drifted down the lane, drew beside the early leader and was caught by a fast outside closer at the last sixteenth, battled in between two other rivals and came away with a good second. MONARCH'S MISCHIEF was in the second tier in the three path, quickly advance and shifted out four wide to draw next to the other pace setters, improved position and continued to lead in a set while shifting over into the two path, was ridden under strong urging entering the stretch run, shook the other runner who was leading in a set with him, briefly had the lead but was soon challenged by a pair of outside closers, participated in a three way race to the wire and came out third running a game race just the same. RELENTLESS DANCER vied for the lead, set he pace for the first half, was collared at the three sixteenth, faded after that. INTO WISHING showed little. WISE ANCHOR vied for the early lead, helped set the fractions from the rail and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Play Mo
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd tier, 3w, bid 3/8, shifted out 5w, closed, 3way battle, 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Monarch's Mischief
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd tier 3w, moved up 4w, led, shook early leader, battled, 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Galaxy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, bid 3/8, 7w stretch, closed, 3way battle, up

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Jason Hall, Jeffrey Neese, and Jon Dean

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 117 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CABO COWGIRL used her natural speed to take the lead, followed the rail around the track at her own pace, ran professionally down the stretch, passed the wire uncontested, showed a beautiful debut for a two year old filly. SISTER HONEY was sent after the leader out of the gates, was three wide stalking the leader, continued to chase the leader down the stretch and to the wire proving to be second best today. GOOD BY FAITH showed brief speed, settled off the pace mid pack, saved ground and was up for third. TAKE HER AWAY was off a bit slow, raced in the two path and next to an outside rival down the back stretch, edged away from her company entering the stretch and maintained her position until the finish. FOREIGN TOURIST was never involved. BETONYA trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Take Her Away
ENTRY.OWNER: Gillis, Betty J. and Joseph A.
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slw, 2w, off pace, in company, to no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Good by Faith
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, mid pack, rail, up for third

ENTRY.NAME: Cabo Cowgirl
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, set the fractions, went uncontested, muchthebest

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent, stalked, chased, 3w, second best today

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 40. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD THREE YEAR OLDS, 119 LBS.; OLDER, 124 LBS. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMUGLERS BLUES showed early speed, raced just off the leader in the two path, was joined by an outside contender just after the half mile pole, raced in a set through the turn and past the quarter pole, while still stalking the early leader, shifted over a lane in the upper stretch, shook her previous company and in the next two strides collared the early leader and took over the leading position, finished the last eighth of a mile alone on the lead and drawing away. BLESS D'SOUTH was settled off of the pace wile being thee wide, launched a bid at the half mile pole, started gaining ground, circled through the turn, angled out into the six path in the upper had to much to do to over come the eventual winner stretch, was encouraged and responded well, closing in on the early leader with every stride, had too much to do to over come the eventual winner but out finished the rest and ran a game second. NOWNOWDANCER showed early speed and inherited the lead, was pressured by an inside foe until the quarter pole, starting tiring after that. THAT IS AWESOME settled off the pace, raced on the rail angled out three wide at the five sixteenth pole, move next to the eventual winner, but lacked a late bid. JIVIN ASTRO made no impact. DON'T BLINK TWICE trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Smuglers Blues
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, company, shook rival, caught leader, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Bless d'South
ENTRY.OWNER: Haas Margaret Lanetta and Womack Larry D
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3w, bid 1/2, circled turn, 6w, closed well, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Jivin Astro
ENTRY.OWNER: Jarrett Jr Terrell and Lara Racing Stables LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 7 1/2F Turf CR: 89. Allowance Purse 29000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 11 Allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DECCAN PRINCE (IRE) broke well and let his speed carry him to the front while racing on a loose rein, took the rail and was asked to relax while setting the fractions, showed the way willingly leading the rest past the five sixteenth pole, was gathered up and given the cue at the quarter pole, happily kicked into what seemed like another gear and drew away winning by a good margin. BUTLER CABIN was racing three wide and off of the early pace, starting inching closer after launching a bid at the half mile pole, circled the field in the turn, responded well to urging and continued to close down the stretch, cleared the rest of the field at the eighth pole, could not catch his stable mate today but was definitely second best. CLARESTOWN was off the pace early on, advanced and improved position, before the half mile pole, raced in a set with the second place finisher and split horses at the half mile pole, was two wide and closing entering the stretch and tired. RUSSIAN TANK was three wide while racing off the pace and in between horses, was steadied a slight bit, lost momentum, had no late kick. FORTY THREE was three wide and racing from the second tier, maintained that position until the three eighths pole, was collared at the five sixteenth pole, battled on into the stretch but gave way late. VETERAN'S HOLIDAY trailed early and slightly improved position late. FATHER RED showed little. BIG SUCCESS trailed though out.

ENTRY.NAME: Clarestown
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pce, 3w, set, moved up, split horses 1/2, 2 wide, turn, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Butler Cabin
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, off pace, bid 1/2, circled turn, cleared the rest 16th, 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Russian Tank
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, off pce, btwn, outside, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Forty Three
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 15500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 11 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUICK TO BLAME raced from off the pace early, along the rail, launched a bid at the half, shifted out and joined the early leaders at the five sixteenth pole, battled down the lane with an outside foe while closing ground on the early leader, repelled his battling foe at the eighth pole and went on to chase down the one who lead through out, drew next to him matched strides, exchanged blows with every stride all the way to the wire, at the finish it was too close to tell ending in a dead heat. PESO IN MY POCKET vied for the lead, raced on the rail, set the pace, looked like a winner until the eighth pole, was challenged by an outside closer, battled, dug in, matched strides all the way to the wire ending in a dead heat. CRIMSON STORM stalked the leader, improved position near the half, drew next to the leader and challenged through the turn then faded. CHIEF CHEETAH was well off the pace early, stayed on the rail while improving position, saved ground through the turn passing along the inside and making up ground, maintained position after that. OXXON had no impact. OBVIOUSLY TOO showed brief speed then faded after the half. BOLD N WILD trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Quick to Blame
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, bid1/2, challngd 5-16th, battled,rplld,clsd ,dh

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Peso in My Pocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, pace, battled late, dead heated

ENTRY.NAME: Bold N Wild
ENTRY.OWNER: Evans, Johnny B. and Eoff, Terry

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 18500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 11, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000, if for $17,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUMMER LIGHTNING stalked the early leader while racing two wide, challenged and prevailed at the quarter pole and scored an easy win. BLUEBIRD SING raced from off the pace in the three path, was allowed to settle early on, launched a bid at he half mile pole, closed well and under strong urging was up in time for second. THE NEXT BIG BLING vied for the lead, took control, saved ground while setting the pace then faded. NAVAGATIONALBEACON raced from off the pace early and showed a mild improvement late. MISS JAMIE made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Bluebird Sing
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, settled, bid 1/2, closed, up for second

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 5F Turf CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TWO HANDS FULL was reluctant to load, broke well, raced on the rail in a stalking position, improved position through the turn, gained ground in the stretch, shifted out into the three path late, split horses in the last sixteenth and was up for the win. KISS UPON A STAR raced off the pace three wide, closed through the turn and into the stretch, battled after the last sixteenth, just missed. MISCHIEVOUS ME was four wide while stalking the pace, advanced in the turn along the out side, closed well under urging, challenged for the lead, battled a few strides and finished third. SHESTHEBIGGAME vied for the lead, raced on the rail, was challenged buy outside foe at the five sixteenth pole, battled down the lane then tired. SWEET SASSICAIA mild bid late. SWEET N SALTY raced off the pace, and maintained positioning through out. IRISH WRIT was not a factor. LADY KRISTEN flashed early speed, tired. DAZZLING THE MOON showed little. BOSTON MILLIE mild bid early.

ENTRY.NAME: Two Hands Full
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant to load, rail,clean trip bid 1/4,shifted out3w,split,up

ENTRY.NAME: Kiss Upon a Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3w, closed late, battled, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Shesthebiggame
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, challenged 5-16th, battled, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Writ
ENTRY.OWNER: L and N Racing LLC and Brewster Clark O

ENTRY.NAME: Boston Millie
ENTRY.OWNER: Schmidt Denise and High River Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Mischievous Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, stalked, advanced turn, closed, battled, up for third
